summary: The '9–8–8 Lifeline Cybersecurity Responsibility Act' aims to protect the 9–8–8 National Suicide Prevention Lifeline from cybersecurity threats. It mandates coordination with the Department of Health and Human Services to secure the program, requires reporting of vulnerabilities and incidents within 24 hours, and establishes oversight responsibilities. The bill also directs the Comptroller General to conduct a study evaluating cybersecurity risks associated with the lifeline.
